def.dt: :along or close at the side We waited for the other boat to come alongside.
:next to or together with (someone or something) :alongside The police car pulled up alongside of our car. children working alongside of their parents
:next to (someone or something) The children work alongside their parents in the field.
:along the side of (something) Bring the boat alongside the dock.
:at the same time as (something) :together with (something) one theory taught alongside the other The town grew up alongside the college.
